I want you to be pleased with my sacrifice, with my offering that when we… We come to the house of, you know, giving is part of worship. We prepare our hearts to give unto the Lord. And there's all this preparation, and we see it in the beginning of Genesis 35. And I hope that as we look at this text of Scripture that we see that worship takes place. But oh, how important that preparation is. Oh, how important that preparation is. I trust that God would help us in 2023 to see God for who He is, to understand that He is worthy of our worship, and that we would be prepared when we enter into the house of God to meet with God and to worship God. I hope that when you drive here on Sunday morning, when you drive here on Sunday night, you have this heart of expectation, anticipation, we're gonna meet with God, we're gonna meet with God. And I want God to challenge me and speak to me and meet with me, that preparation. Why do we pray before our services the way that we do? Well, the Bible says the house of God is to be a house of prayer. That time of prayer, those couple of minutes of corporate prayer, has been implemented so that we would pray that God would meet with us. It's not to pray for some sick relative. Now, I'm not criticizing you if you've done that. What I'm saying is that that is specific prayer time for God meet with us. God work in my life first, and then in the lives of those that are gathered. We have come to worship. Let's pray together. Father, we love you. We thank you for loving us. Thank you for a place called Bethel, the house of God. I believe this evening that this place was special to Jacob. God, as we look at this Old Testament account of this man and his family as they journeyed, God, I pray that you'd help us in our own lives, that we would worship you in spirit and in truth. God, we'd understand that you're a holy God. You're worthy of our worship. I hope this evening that we would prepare to worship you. We'd make the decisions necessary, maybe even difficult decisions, in that process of preparation, so that we would be ready to worship. I pray that you'd move and work in these moments of invitation as only you can. I pray, God, that decisions would be made that would please me. We'll thank you for all that you'll do, for it's in Christ's name we pray. Would you stand?
